page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block is very sparsely populated save for a small area to the north west which includes the outskirts of Minehead;Woodcombe,a pleasant residential area,and part of a housing estate partly built by the{Greater {London Council}a few years ago to house some of their elderly overspill population.Two thirds of the remaining area is rich farmland growing cereals and keeping beef cattle and sheep.Some of the farmers graze their sheep on open moorland during the summer.There are several large farms,some owned by the National Trust and some by the Lytton family centred locally at Bratton Court,a{medieval manor house.} The remainder of the land is deciduous and mixed woodland managed by the National Trust and the Forestry Commission.Much of the woodland is accessible to the public.
